series_title: Disclosure Forms For Members of the Senate of Virginia and Senate Candidates
series_description: Documents the reporting by Senate members of the economic interests and relationships, which may create conflicts of legislative interest. The Senators submit disclosure forms to the Clerk of Senate each year and the Clerk maintains the record pursuant to
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on schedule cover page.
legal_citation: Code of Virginia ยง2.1-639.40. These forms contain the name and address of the member, the economic interests of the individual and his (or her) immediate family; and the entities to which services were furnished or compensation received in excess of ($1,000) for the year.

series_description: Documents each joint subcommittee and commission.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_title: Members of the Senate Correspondence and Reference Records
series_description: Documents each Senator's legislative career and communication with the Clerk of the Senate. Records are maintained by the Clerk to provide a reference service to members of the Senate.
retention_statement: Retain permanently in the Office of the Clerk.

series_title: Original Bills, Resolutions, Joint Resolutions, and Related Attachments
series_description: Documents the legislation proposed and acted upon by the Senate during session. The original bills, resolutions and joint resolutions are used to prepare the engrossed bills, resolutions, and joint resolutions and are retained for documentation by the Clerk. Refer to
retention_statement: Retain 1 year, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_description: Documents the recordings of the proceedings and the legislative business for each day in which the Senate is in session. The rough journal is used by the Senate to prepare the text for the published Senate Journal. The Journal contains Senate procedures and order of business for the day; Calendar of Bills and Resolutions Referred and Notices; original Senate roll call forms; original Senate amendment forms; original House communications; Senate agenda; and original correspondence to the Senate from the Governor, the Supreme Court of Virginia, and the State Board of Elections.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.

series_description: Documents the work of the Senate standing committees.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years, then transfer records to the , Library of Virginia for permanent retention.
